rDuck-H6N1 preferentially bound to 30SLNLN, with no detectable binding to 60SLNLN.

The chicken-H6N1-189 (H5)-224 (H5) HA mutant shows preferential binding to the a2,3-linked sialylglycan receptor but undetectable binding to the a2,6-linked sialylglycan receptor, which mimics the duck-H6N1 HA. The ‘avian-signature’ residue Q222 (H5) forms two hydrogen bonds with the Sia-1
The Gal-2 rotates by ~60°, which might result from the P185L (H5) substitution.
The chicken-H6N1-185 (H5) HA mutant shows significantly reduced binding to the a2,3-linked sialylglycan receptor
In the hH6/60SLNLN complex, Q222 (H5) forms a hydrogen bond with the Gal-2. The Gal-2 rotates by ~60°, which might result from the P185L (H5) substitution.

quote: a subtle conformation adjustment occurs when cH6 and hH6 bind to different receptor analogs, as a result of the P185L (H5) substitution

the human receptor analogs bind in a similar cis conformation in the AHH7 and InH5mut complexes, but the directions of the Gal-2/GlcNAc-3 linkage site are different. The Gal-2/GlcNAc-3 moieties fold back and go through the 189 (H5)-helix in the InH5mut complex, like that in the pandemic H1, H2, and H3 complexes
an artificial V185N (H5) substitution reduces the binding to the avian receptor analog while increasing the binding to the human receptor analog
